definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: Hitchcock also got a perverse thrill out of taking audiences on a voyeuristic roller-coaster ride.
sentences.chinese: 希区柯克也有有害刺激的考虑受众的偷窥过山车旅程。

sentences.english: The marketing strategy of Taobao makes it easy for customers to know the brand information.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网的营销活动向目标受众准确传达了品牌信息。

sentences.english: The percentage of a station's cume audience that also listened to another station, within some specified period.
sentences.chinese: 在一段特定时期内，两个媒介共享受众的规模。

sentences.english: On the other hand, it blurs out status of audience and disseminators further.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，它进一步模糊了受众和传者的地位。

sentences.english: The notion of presenting it to this particular audience was downright scary.
sentences.chinese: 其向这个特殊的受众宣传的概念显然非常可怕。

sentences.english: It’s not just about messages and targets.
sentences.chinese: 它不仅是关于信息和目标受众。

sentences.english: Writing successfully requires knowing how to attract niche audiences with depth and detail.
sentences.chinese: 胜利的写作要供懂得怎样深刻过细地吸引住特定受众。

sentences.english: Your audience's promotion is the most targeted groups.
sentences.chinese: 您宣传推广的受众者将是最具针对性的群体。

sentences.english: Issues quickly get polarized, and then further polarized by the media, which needs extreme viewpoints to draw attention and increase audience size.
sentences.chinese: 媒体需要偏激的观点以吸引人们的眼球，扩大受众群。

sentences.english: The advertisement audience has the greatly strengthened selectivity and elusion to the media advertisement.
sentences.chinese: 广告受众对媒介广告有极强的选择性和回避性。

sentences.english: Find the balance from the audience demand and space planning.
sentences.chinese: 从受众需求和空间规划中找到平衡点。

sentences.english: There is no captive audience online.
sentences.chinese: 网上没有无路可走的受众。

sentences.english: As the accepter of politic, we hope the society more open and accelerate the democracy.
sentences.chinese: 作为政治的受众，我们期望更加开放和民主的革新。

sentences.english: We had a great number of mass.
It presents content to an audience, against which it sells ads.
sentences.chinese: 因为它向受众呈现内容，并借此销售广告。

sentences.english: It is what our audiences want and expect.
sentences.chinese: 这正是受众想要的，也是他们期望的。

definition: minority of the population/non-mainstream (activity, pursuit etc)/niche (market etc)
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
the masses/the great bulk of the population/popular (of music, science etc)
